com.smartnsoft.droid4me.app

Class ActivityController

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.smartnsoft.droid4me.app.ActivityController

  • public class ActivityController
extends java.lang.Object
    Is responsible for intercepting an activity starting and redirect it to a prerequisite one if necessary, and for handling globally exceptions.

    Everything described here which involves the activities, is applicable provided the activity is a Smartable.

    It is also a container for multiple interfaces relative to its architecture.

    Since:
    2009.04.28
    Author:
    Ã‰douard Mercier

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static interface  ActivityController.EscapeToRedirector
      Deprecated. 
      now use the ActivityController.EscapeToRedirectorAnnotation annotation instead
      static interface  ActivityController.EscapeToRedirectorAnnotation
      An annotation which offers the same effect as the ActivityController.EscapeToRedirector interface.
      static interface  ActivityController.ExceptionHandler
      Defines and splits the handling of various exceptions in a single place.
      static interface  ActivityController.Interceptor
      An interface which is queried during the various life cycle events of a LifeCycle.
      static class  ActivityController.IssueAnalyzer
      Responsible for analyzing issues resulting from Throwable entities.
      static interface  ActivityController.Redirector
      An interface which is requested when a new Activity is bound to be started.
      static interface  ActivityController.SystemServiceProvider
      An interface responsible for providing Android system services, given their name.

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static java.lang.String CALLING_INTENT
      When a new activity is started because of a redirection, the newly started activity will receive the initial activity Intent through this Parcelable key.

      • extractCallingIntent

        public static android.content.Intent extractCallingIntent(android.app.Activity activity)
        Attempts to decode from the provided activity the original Intent that was
        Parameters:
        activity - the Activity whose Intent will be analyzed
        Returns:
        an Intent that may be started if the provided activity actually contains a reference to another Activity ; null otherwise
        See Also:
        CALLING_INTENT, needsRedirection(Activity), #registerInterceptor(ActivityController. Interceptor)

      • registerSystemServiceProvider

        public void registerSystemServiceProvider(ActivityController.SystemServiceProvider systemServiceProvider)
        Remembers the system service provider that will be used by the framework, for overriding the Activity.getSystemService(String) method.
        Parameters:
        systemServiceProvider - the system service provider which will be invoked at runtime, when an Activity asks for a service ; if null, the Activity default service will be used

      • registerRedirector

        public void registerRedirector(ActivityController.Redirector redirector)
        Remembers the activity redirector that will be used by the framework, before starting a new Activity.
        Parameters:
        redirector - the redirector that will be requested at runtime, when a new activity is being started; if null, no redirection mechanism will be set up

      • registerInterceptor

        public void registerInterceptor(ActivityController.Interceptor interceptor)
        Remembers the activity interceptor that will be used by the framework, on every event during the underlying Activity life cycle.
        Parameters:
        interceptor - the interceptor that will be invoked at runtime, on every event; if null, no interception mechanism will be used

      • getSystemService

        public java.lang.Object getSystemService(android.app.Activity activity,
                                java.lang.String name,
                                java.lang.Object defaultService)
        Is responsible for returning a system service, just like the Context.getSystemService(String) method does.
        Parameters:
        activity - the activity asking for a system service
        name - the name of the desired service
        defaultService - the activity default service
        Returns:
        the service or null if the name does not exist
        See Also:
        registerSystemServiceProvider(ActivityController.SystemServiceProvider)

      • getExceptionHandler

        public ActivityController.ExceptionHandler getExceptionHandler()
        Gives access to the currently registered ActivityController.ExceptionHandler.
        Returns:
        the currently registered exception handler ; may be null, which is the default status
        See Also:
        registerExceptionHandler(ActivityController.ExceptionHandler)

      • registerExceptionHandler

        public void registerExceptionHandler(ActivityController.ExceptionHandler exceptionHandler)
        Remembers the exception handler that will be used by the framework.
        Parameters:
        exceptionHandler - the handler that will be invoked in case of exception; if null, no exception handler will be used
        See Also:
        getExceptionHandler()

      • onLifeCycleEvent

        public void onLifeCycleEvent(android.app.Activity activity,
                    java.lang.Object component,
                    ActivityController.Interceptor.InterceptorEvent event)
        Is invoked by the framework every time a life cycle event occurs for the provided activity. You should not invoke that method yourself!

        Note that the method is synchronized, which means that the previous call will block the next one, if no thread is spawn.

        Parameters:
        activity - the activity which is involved with the event : cannot be null
        component - the component the event occurs on ; may be {code null}
        event - the event that has just happened for that activity

      • handleException

        public boolean handleException(boolean isRecoverable,
                      android.content.Context context,
                      java.lang.Object component,
                      java.lang.Throwable throwable)
        Dispatches the exception to the ActivityController.ExceptionHandler, and invokes the right method depending on its nature.

        The framework is responsible for invoking that method every time an unhandled exception is thrown. If no exception handler is registered, the exception will be only logged, and the method will return false.

        Note that this method is synchronized, which prevents it from being invoking while it is already being executed, and which involves that only one Throwable may be handled at the same time.

        Parameters:
        isRecoverable - indicates whether the application is about to crash when the exception has been triggered
        context - the context that originated the exception ; may be null
        component - when not null, this will be the Fragment the exception has been thrown from
        throwable - the reported exception
        Returns:
        true if the exception has been handled ; in particular, if no exception handled has been set, returns false

      • needsRedirection

        public boolean needsRedirection(android.app.Activity activity)
        Indicates whether a redirection is required before letting the activity continue its life cycle. It launches the redirected Activity if a redirection is need, and provide to its Intent the initial activity Intent trough the extra Parcelable CALLING_INTENT key.

        If the provided activity implements the ActivityController.EscapeToRedirector interface or exposes the ActivityController.EscapeToRedirectorAnnotation annotation, the method returns false.

        Note that this method does not need to be marked as synchronized, because it is supposed to be invoked systematically from the UI thread.

        Parameters:
        activity - the activity which is being proved against the ActivityController.Redirector
        Returns:
        true if and only if the given activity should be paused (or ended) and if another activity should be launched instead through the Activity.startActivity(Intent) method
        See Also:
        extractCallingIntent(Activity), ActivityController.Redirector.getRedirection(Activity), ActivityController.EscapeToRedirector, ActivityController.EscapeToRedirectorAnnotation
